newsitem.title: BELGIUM: SOCCER-WALEM STRIKE GIVES UNINSPIRED ANDERLECHT VICTORY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-WALEM STRIKE GIVES UNINSPIRED ANDERLECHT VICTORY.

text.p: A second half strike by Belgium midfielder Johan Walem helped seasoned European campaigners Anderlecht squeeze past Helsingborg of Sweden into the UEFA Cup quarter-finals on Tuesday.

The prestigious Brussels club, just a pale shadow of the glorious team which won the UEFA Cup in 1983, created few clear chances until Walem broke the goalless deadlock in the 68th minute. They won 1-0 on aggregate.
The mercurial Walem lifted the ball over goalkeeper Sven Andersson after Anderlecht's Swedish international midfielder Par Zetterberg had beaten four Helsingborg defenders.
Helsingborg came close to an equaliser two minutes from time but Glen De Boeck cleared the loose ball just in time.
The victory restored some pride for the Belgians who have slipped to eighth in the domestic standings, their lowest position for 26 years.
"This is a transitional year for us and this victory should finally give us some confidence again after four or five goalless draws," Anderlecht manager Michel Verschueren said.
